<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/great-corporate-tax-negotiation-begun?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who Is Going to Pay for the Infrastructure Plan?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/great-corporate-tax-negotiation-begun" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Infrastructure meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjYxL2luZnJhc3RydWN0dXJlX21lbWUuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Neal Freyman</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We called Mexico—no dice. Instead, the Biden administration revealed a plan yesterday that would <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-07/yellen-sees-tax-plan-reclaiming-2-trillion-in-overseas-profits?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hike taxes on corporations</a> in order to pay for its $2.3 trillion proposal to revamp the nation’s roads, transit, ports, and more. The details:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The corporate tax rate would increase to 28% from its current 21%.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Profitable companies earning $2 billion or more would face a </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-softens-tax-proposal-aimed-at-profitable-companies-that-pay-little-11617809422?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15% minimum tax</a></span><span> on the income they report to investors, a rule targeting serial tax avoiders.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The tax rate on companies’ foreign earnings would double, from 10.5% to 21%.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This isn’t a prix fixe menu. In a speech, Biden said he was <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/04/07/us/biden-news-today?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open to compromise</a> on how to pay for the plan, but insisted he would “not be open to doing nothing” on infrastructure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The case for a tax hike:</strong> Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen portrayed it as a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/2ce7b9f2-6b53-4836-835c-2faba997c936?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">net positive</a> for corporations: You pay more in taxes→we give you more support, such as quality transportation networks and high-speed broadband, to help your business grow. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>She said that the government’s investments in infrastructure will add 1.6% to US GDP by 2024. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not everyone loves hiking </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sen. Joe Manchin, a moderate Democrat who wields a lot of power in the Senate, said he doesn’t support raising the corporate tax rate above 25%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, a who’s who of business trade groups <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/49290545-99c7-47f0-ad19-4673ad762002?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">object</a> to the increase.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">US Chamber of Commerce:</strong></span><span> The proposal is “dangerously misguided.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">National Association of Manufacturers:</strong></span><span> Higher taxes will “turn back the clock to the archaic tax policies that gave other countries an advantage over America.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Business Roundtable:</strong></span><span> The plan would create “new barriers to job creation and economic growth.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some execs do support the plan. Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos <a href="https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/policy-news-views/a-message-from-jeff-bezos?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">endorsed</a> Biden’s infrastructure proposal and a corporate tax hike on Tuesday, saying, “This investment will require concessions from all sides.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While all this is going on in the US, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/07/economy/global-minimum-corporate-tax-g20/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">momentum is building</a> for a global minimum corporate tax rate, which would eliminate companies’ HQ-hopping to the most attractive tax location. Finance ministers said they could elbow bump on a plan as early as July. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RIDESHARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/uber-invest-250-million-bring-back-drivers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber’s Plan: Throw Money at the Problem
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/uber-invest-250-million-bring-back-drivers" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Car with Uber logo stuffed full of cash" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjU4L3ViZXJfY2FzaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We may never get back to the Uber Pool days (which is more than OK), but Uber execs are bracing for a ridership surge in the coming months and need more folks at the wheel. The company is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-07/uber-to-spend-250-million-to-boost-number-of-u-s-drivers?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spending</a> $250 million to recruit and retain drivers: bonuses, guaranteed pay, onboarding, anything you want babe, Uber just wants you back.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Lyft has also acknowledged that rider demand is outstripping driver supply, and re-engaging drivers has been as difficult as “turning the Titanic," said one of Lyft’s executives.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Q1 2021, the number of drivers logging onto the Uber app each day was down ~40% over last year, per Apptopia. That’s meant riders around the country have experienced significantly longer wait times and surge pricing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Both companies are trying to move past 2020 like it's a bad yearbook photo. Uber focused most of its energy beefing up food delivery service and Lyft focused on being the second app you open when Uber seems too expensive, but neither could make up for vanishing airport drop-offs: They lost a combined $8.5 billion last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Uber's and Lyft's pushes to hire more drivers come as other industries like restaurants, airlines, and manufacturing <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/us-companies-trouble-finding-qualified-workers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struggle</a> to attract workers they let go at the beginning of the pandemic.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/twitch-expands-user-moderation-beyond-platform?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Twitch’s Moderators Are Zooming Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="PARIS, FRANCE - OCTOBER 29: The video game streaming and VOD service log..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjYwL3BhcmlzX2dhbWVzX3dlZWtfMjAxOV9wLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chesnot/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Twitch wants to know what its streamers are up to when they’re not playing <em>Warzone</em> at 4am. The Amazon-owned streaming platform will be <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/twitch-off-platform-policy-harassment/?utm_source=WIR_REG_GATE&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigating reports</a> of its users committing “serious offenses that pose a substantial safety risk to the community”—both on other online platforms, like Discord or Twitter, and IRL. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The impetus for change: </strong>From July–December of last year, Twitch received 7.4 million reports of on-platform actions that <a href="https://www.twitch.tv/p/en/legal/transparency-report/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">violated its rules</a>, and Twitch COO Sara Clemens told Wired that off-platform indiscretions are “a threat vector” that increases on-platform violations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Twitch isn’t the first platform to break down the walls of its content garden. YouTube has demonetized users who misbehaved elsewhere, and Patreon has kicked one off. But Twitch is the first to formally publicize its stance.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Twitch <a href="https://blog.twitch.tv/en/2021/04/07/our-plan-for-addressing-severe-off-service-misconduct/?utm_referrer=https://t.co/&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wants to be known</a> as a “service,” not a “platform,” because anyone who’s tried to walk barefoot off the beach and directly into Nobu knows a “service” can turn away customers at the door.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Upon verifying with the United States Postal Service, we can confirm that the abbreviation for Ohio is “OH.” And upon conferring amongst ourselves, we have evidence to believe “OH” stands for “Opportunity Here.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You see, we’re not conspiracy theorists. We <a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>STATE</em> the facts</a>. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, the state boasts a 5.6 million-strong workforce with approximately 32K STEM graduates in 2019 alone—so yeah, they get talent. (And you will too, wink wink.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Looking to buy an abode</a>? Four Ohio cities rank in the <strong style="color:#000">10 Best Cities for Millennial Homebuyers:</strong><strong style="color:#000"> Cincinnati (#10), Columbus (#8), Akron (#7), and Dayton (#4). </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oh readers, Ohio has opportunity written all over it. </p>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/key-performance-indicators-april-8?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/key-performance-indicators-april-8" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Joe Rogan podcast Spotify " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjc3L2pvZV9yb2dhbl9wb2RjYXN0X3Nwb3RpZnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>26% of podcasts in the Apple Podcasts app have produced <a href="https://www.amplifimedia.com/blogstein/why-there-really-arent-2-million-podcasts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just one episode</a>, according to digital audio agency Amplifi Media. We all kinda knew this was true, but...wow. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“It’s a nuclear reactor that has set off a chain reaction and is out of control. It’s a biological Fukushima.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brazil’s Covid-19 crisis is <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-brazil/a-biological-fukushima-brazil-covid-19-deaths-on-track-to-pass-worst-of-u-s-wave-idUSKBN2BT30P?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">devastating</a> its healthcare system, Miguel Nicolelis, a Brazilian doctor and Duke University professor, told Reuters. Brazil reported more than 4,000 Covid deaths for the first time on Tuesday, and will soon likely surpass the US’ peak daily death toll from January. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>“Evidence is mounting that a tiny subatomic particle is being influenced by forms of matter and energy that are not yet known to science but which may nevertheless affect the nature and evolution of the universe.” (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/07/science/particle-physics-muon-fermilab-brookhaven.html?smtyp=cur&smid=tw-nytimes&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VENTURE CAPITAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/global-venture-funding-hits-record-high-2021s-first-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Funds Will Never End
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Crunchbase Venture Capital chart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjU5L2NydW5jaGJhc2VfdmVudHVyZV9jYXBpdGFsX2NoYXJ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Crunchbase</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s Venture Time! According to a new report from Crunchbase, global venture funding <a href="https://news.crunchbase.com/news/global-venture-hits-an-all-time-high-in-q1-2021-a-record-125-billion-funding/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hit a new record</a> in the first quarter of 2021: $125 billion. That’s a 50% increase from the prior quarter and a 94% jump over Q1 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lots of Lady Rainicorns rode that investment boom: Approximately two startups joined the Crunchbase Private Unicorn Board per working day in Q1. (A “unicorn” is a private startup that’s valued at $1 billion or more.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Diving in deeper...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>68% of funding went to “late-stage” companies, or startups that had already secured earlier rounds of investment. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The sectors that pulled in the most investment include health care, finance, transportation, and retail, while those with the biggest increases over last year were admin, lending, and sales and marketing. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Another area to keep an eye on? Crypto</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Blockchain startups raised more money last quarter <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-01/crypto-firms-got-more-funding-last-quarter-than-in-all-of-2020?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">than in all of 2020</a>, per CB Insights. Some notable fundraisers in the space include crypto lending service BlockFi, digital wallet provider Blockchain.com, and Dapper Labs, which runs the NFT platforms NBA Top Shot and CryptoKitties.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> brings you our favorite business-related reads. Today, we’re going behind the scenes of America’s second-largest private employer.</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Amazon’s operating principles are no secret, but </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781250267597?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Working Backwards</em></a></span><span> by former execs Colin Bryar and Bill Carr offers an insider’s view of how a culture grounded in customer obsession and innovation built its blockbuster products.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But reshaping e-commerce has had darker implications for some communities. </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780374159276?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Fulfillment</em></a></span><span><span> by journalist Alec MacGillis explores the human costs that have accompanied Amazon’s sprawling footprint. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Godzilla and King Kong actually worked together to figure out which one of these headlines from the week’s news was fake and which three were real. They failed...maybe you’ll have better luck spotting the headline we made up.</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“A man </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/01/us/bees-car-new-mexico.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found</a></span><span> 15,000 bees in his car after grocery shopping”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Washington man </span><span><a href="https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/washington-man-pleads-guilty-244-million-ghost-cattle-scam?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pleads</a></span><span> guilty to $244 million ghost-cattle scam”</span>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTAXES \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWho Is Going to Pay for the Infrastructure Plan?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/07/great-corporate-tax-negotiation-begun\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Infrastructure meme\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NjYxL2luZnJhc3RydWN0dXJlX21lbWUuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNeal Freyman\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe called Mexico—no dice. Instead, the Biden administration revealed a plan yesterday that would \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-07/yellen-sees-tax-plan-reclaiming-2-trillion-in-overseas-profits?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehike taxes on corporations\u003c/a\u003e in order to pay for its $2.3 trillion proposal to revamp the nation’s roads, transit, ports, and more. The details:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe corporate tax rate would increase to 28% from its current 21%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eProfitable companies earning $2 billion or more would face a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/biden-softens-tax-proposal-aimed-at-profitable-companies-that-pay-little-11617809422?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e15% minimum tax\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on the income they report to investors, a rule targeting serial tax avoiders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe tax rate on companies’ foreign earnings would double, from 10.5% to 21%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis isn’t a prix fixe menu. In a speech, Biden said he was \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/04/07/us/biden-news-today?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen to compromise\u003c/a\u003e on how to pay for the plan, but insisted he would “not be open to doing nothing” on infrastructure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe case for a tax hike:\u003c/strong\u003e Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen portrayed it as a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/2ce7b9f2-6b53-4836-835c-2faba997c936?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enet positive\u003c/a\u003e for corporations: You pay more in taxes→we give you more support, such as quality transportation networks and high-speed broadband, to help your business grow. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShe said that the government’s investments in infrastructure will add 1.6% to US GDP by 2024. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot everyone loves hiking \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSen. Joe Manchin, a moderate Democrat who wields a lot of power in the Senate, said he doesn’t support raising the corporate tax rate above 25%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, a who’s who of business trade groups \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/49290545-99c7-47f0-ad19-4673ad762002?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eobject\u003c/a\u003e to the increase.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUS Chamber of Commerce:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The proposal is “dangerously misguided.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNational Association of Manufacturers:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Higher taxes will “turn back the clock to the archaic tax policies that gave other countries an advantage over America.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBusiness Roundtable:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e The plan would create “new barriers to job creation and economic growth.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome execs do support the plan. Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos \u003ca href=\"https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/policy-news-views/a-message-from-jeff-bezos?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eendorsed\u003c/a\u003e Biden’s infrastructure proposal and a corporate tax hike on Tuesday, saying, “This investment will require concessions from all sides.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile all this is going on in the US, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/07/economy/global-minimum-corporate-tax-g20/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emomentum is building\u003c/a\u003e for a global minimum corporate tax rate, which would eliminate companies’ HQ-hopping to the most attractive tax location. Finance ministers said they could elbow bump on a plan as early as July. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe may never get back to the Uber Pool days (which is more than OK), but Uber execs are bracing for a ridership surge in the coming months and need more folks at the wheel. The company is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-07/uber-to-spend-250-million-to-boost-number-of-u-s-drivers?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espending\u003c/a\u003e $250 million to recruit and retain drivers: bonuses, guaranteed pay, onboarding, anything you want babe, Uber just wants you back.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLyft has also acknowledged that rider demand is outstripping driver supply, and re-engaging drivers has been as difficult as “turning the Titanic,\" said one of Lyft’s executives.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Q1 2021, the number of drivers logging onto the Uber app each day was down ~40% over last year, per Apptopia. That’s meant riders around the country have experienced significantly longer wait times and surge pricing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth companies are trying to move past 2020 like it's a bad yearbook photo. Uber focused most of its energy beefing up food delivery service and Lyft focused on being the second app you open when Uber seems too expensive, but neither could make up for vanishing airport drop-offs: They lost a combined $8.5 billion last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eUber's and Lyft's pushes to hire more drivers come as other industries like restaurants, airlines, and manufacturing \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/06/us-companies-trouble-finding-qualified-workers?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estruggle\u003c/a\u003e to attract workers they let go at the beginning of the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwitch wants to know what its streamers are up to when they’re not playing \u003cem\u003eWarzone\u003c/em\u003e at 4am. The Amazon-owned streaming platform will be \u003ca href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/twitch-off-platform-policy-harassment/?utm_source=WIR_REG_GATE\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigating reports\u003c/a\u003e of its users committing “serious offenses that pose a substantial safety risk to the community”—both on other online platforms, like Discord or Twitter, and IRL. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe impetus for change: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom July–December of last year, Twitch received 7.4 million reports of on-platform actions that \u003ca href=\"https://www.twitch.tv/p/en/legal/transparency-report/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eviolated its rules\u003c/a\u003e, and Twitch COO Sara Clemens told Wired that off-platform indiscretions are “a threat vector” that increases on-platform violations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwitch isn’t the first platform to break down the walls of its content garden. YouTube has demonetized users who misbehaved elsewhere, and Patreon has kicked one off. But Twitch is the first to formally publicize its stance.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eTwitch \u003ca href=\"https://blog.twitch.tv/en/2021/04/07/our-plan-for-addressing-severe-off-service-misconduct/?utm_referrer=https://t.co/\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewants to be known\u003c/a\u003e as a “service,” not a “platform,” because anyone who’s tried to walk barefoot off the beach and directly into Nobu knows a “service” can turn away customers at the door.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eCrunchbase\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s Venture Time! According to a new report from Crunchbase, global venture funding \u003ca href=\"https://news.crunchbase.com/news/global-venture-hits-an-all-time-high-in-q1-2021-a-record-125-billion-funding/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehit a new record\u003c/a\u003e in the first quarter of 2021: $125 billion. That’s a 50% increase from the prior quarter and a 94% jump over Q1 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLots of Lady Rainicorns rode that investment boom: Approximately two startups joined the Crunchbase Private Unicorn Board per working day in Q1. (A “unicorn” is a private startup that’s valued at $1 billion or more.)\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDiving in deeper...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e68% of funding went to “late-stage” companies, or startups that had already secured earlier rounds of investment. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe sectors that pulled in the most investment include health care, finance, transportation, and retail, while those with the biggest increases over last year were admin, lending, and sales and marketing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnother area to keep an eye on? Crypto\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBlockchain startups raised more money last quarter \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-04-01/crypto-firms-got-more-funding-last-quarter-than-in-all-of-2020?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethan in all of 2020\u003c/a\u003e, per CB Insights. Some notable fundraisers in the space include crypto lending service BlockFi, digital wallet provider Blockchain.com, and Dapper Labs, which runs the NFT platforms NBA Top Shot and
